result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Fredrick Little was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:31 AM Defendant Ryan Fredrick Little in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Ryan Fredrick Little.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement that the repeater in Count 1 and Count 2 be stricken. For count 1, 9 months jail, concurrent to Count 2, imposed and stayed for 2 years probation. Conditions of probation include serve 29 days with credit for 29 days, comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC and pay a $100 fine plus costs. If revoked, jail time consecutive to any other cases. For Count 2, 6 months jail, concurrent to Count 1,  imposed and stayed for 2 years probation. Conditions of probation include serve 29 days with credit for 29 days and comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC. If revoked, jail time consecutive to any other cases. Defendant pleads no contest to Counts 1 and 2. Attorney Rosenthal stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.

Court imposes for Count 1 (repeater struck), 9 months jail, concurrent to Count 2, imposed and stayed for 2 years probation. Conditions of probation include serve 29 days with credit for 29 days, comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC and pay a $100 fine plus costs. If revoked, jail time consecutive to any other cases to include 18CF342. For Count 2, (repeater struck), 6 months jail, concurrent to Count 1,  imposed and stayed for 2 years probation. Conditions of probation include serve 29 days with credit for 29 days and comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC. If revoked, jail time consecutive to any other cases to include 18CF342.

9:53 AM Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan Fredrick Little appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Ryan Fredrick Little. Attorney Rosenthal acknowledges receipt of the information, waives a formal reading, enters a plea of not guilty and requests a status. Court accepts not guilty plea. Attorney Rosenthal indicates defendant will be starting school in August, asks for date before school starts.
Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on June 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Ryan Fredrick Little
Current: 1521 N 21st St, Superior, WI 54880 United States  (Effective: 06-16-2022)
Prior: Homeless, Solon Springs, WI 54873
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:54 PM Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan Fredrick Little appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for Ryan Fredrick Little. Defendant verifies address. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks for $750 cash bail. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. State indicates that defendant has been revoked off of probation 8 times in the last 20 years and is currently on extended supervision. Recites defendant's prior criminal history and FTAs. Attorney Hoffman indicates the defendant has lived in Douglas County for almost his entire life, has family in the area, and local employment. Indicates that probation may be dropping their hold and not revoke him in the file, can post up to $200. Court notes concerns over criminal history, probation revocations, and FTAs. Court orders $1,000 cash bail. Defendant indicates missed court dates were due to being held in custody in MN and indicates that he cannot post the $1,000. Court orders no use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 10:45 am.
